revised_title: Temperature and Carbon-Dioxide Assimilation in Cherry-Laurel Leaves
tldr: This study investigates the effect of temperature on carbon dioxide assimilation in cherry-laurel leaves. The authors find that the amount of CO2 assimilated increases with temperature, reaching a peak at around 38°C before declining rapidly. They also discover that the leaf's internal temperature can be significantly higher than the surrounding environment due to absorbed light radiation.
